data.title: Film 90 – tape 1004
data.meta_description: Here's a tape full of Film 90, so I'm happy. The first episode features Barry Norman's reviews of the following films: The Freshman Love at Large Young Guns II The Handmaid's Tale There's a report on the National Film and Television School. https://youtu.be/iFKYvQmmKcs There's also a follow-up on a report on disabled access to cinemas. BBC…
data.text:
Here’s a tape full of Film 90, so I’m happy. The first episode features Barry Norman’s reviews of the following films:

The Freshman

Love at Large

Young Guns II

The Handmaid’s Tale

There’s a report on the National Film and Television School.

There’s also a follow-up on a report on disabled access to cinemas.

BBC Genome: BBC One – 30th October 1990 – 22:20

In the next episode, there are reviews of:

Flatliners

The Mad Monkey

My Blue Heaven

There’s a look ahead to the London Film Festival. There’s also a look at efforts to preserve old films.

BBC Genome: BBC One – 6th November 1990 – 22:20

In the next episode we have Barry’s verdict on the following films:

Criminal Law

The Icicle Thief

The Reflecting Skin

Darkman

There’s a report on the special effects behind Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.

The show closes with a musical segment from the film Madhouse which I’d always remembered – John Larroquette and a friend dance along to an old motown song, ‘Bernadette’. I don’t know why this clip was something I remembered, but it did stick in my mind. Maybe it’s just to set up another coincidence, when I’d meet and marry a girl called Bernadette four years later.

BBC Genome: BBC One – 13th November 1990 – 22:20

In the next episode we get to hear Barry Norman’s opinions of the following films:

Henry & June

Metropolitan

The Exorcist III

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

Linking to yesterday’s tape, Jason Miller in The Exorcist III.

There’s a look at the importance of film music. It features Michael Kamen.

BBC Genome: BBC One – 20th November 1990 – 23:20

The next episode sees Barry look at the following films:

Come See the Paradise

The Big Picture

The Comfort of Strangers

The Sheltering Sky

Tom Brook reports from New York about Adrian Lyne’s new movie Jacob’s Ladder.

BBC Genome: BBC One – 27th November 1990 – 22:20

In the last episode here, there are reviews of:

Texasville

The Hot Spot

Love Without Pity

Time of the Gypsies

Home Alone

There’s a piece about the restoration of Fantasia.

BBC Genome: BBC One – 3rd December 1990 – 22:10

After this, there’s a trailer for Omnibus on Madonna, and then the tape ends.
